GCMBaseIntentService().Description: Constructor that does not set a sender id, useful when the sender id is context-specific. When using this constructor, the subclass @B_com#google#android#gcm#GCMBaseIntentService#getSenderIds_E@, otherwise methods such as @B_com#google#android#gcm#GCMBaseIntentService#onHandleIntent_E@ will throw an @B_java#lang#IllegalStateException_E@ on runtime.

onMessage(android.content.Context, andro.Description: Called when a cloud message has been received.

ClassDesc: Please use the Skeleton for application-specific @B_android#app#IntentService_E@s responsible for handling communication from Google Cloud Messaging service. The abstract methods in this class are called from its worker thread, and hence should run in a limited amount of time. If they execute long operations, they should spawn new threads, otherwise the worker thread will be blocked. Subclasses must provide a public no-arg constructor.
